client_id.description: Fugue API client ID. Specify using the FUGUE_API_ID environment variable.

client_secret.description: Fugue API client secret. Specify using the FUGUE_API_SECRET environment variable.

compliance_families.description: The set of compliance families to enable in this environment, e.g. ["CIS", "SOC2", "FBP", "NIST", "HIPAA"].

govcloud.description: Indicates whether this is an AWS GovCloud account.

id.description: The unique ID for this environment as generated by Fugue.

regions.description: The AWS region names to include in this environment. Use `*` to capture all supported regions.

resource_types.description: The set of resource types to scan in this environment. You can use the `fugue_aws_types` data source to access the full list.

role_arn.description: The AWS IAM role ARN used to provide Fugue secure access to the AWS account.

scan_interval.description: Controls the time in seconds between scheduled scans of this environment.

scan_schedule_enabled.description: Controls whether this environment is scanned on a schedule.

scan_status.description: Indicates whether a scan on this environment is currently running.

block.description: `fugue_aws_environment` manages an Environment in Fugue corresponding to one AWS account.

application_id.description: The Azure Active Directory application ID used for Fugue.

client_secret.description: The Azure secret generated for the Active Directory application.

compliance_families.description: The set of compliance families to enable in this environment.

id.description: The unique ID for this environment as generated by Fugue.

scan_interval.description: Controls the time in seconds between scheduled scans of this environment.

scan_schedule_enabled.description: Controls whether this environment is scanned on a schedule.

scan_status.description: Indicates whether a scan on this environment is currently running.

block.description: `fugue_azure_environment` manages an Environment in Fugue corresponding to one Azure subscription.

always_enabled.description: Whether the family will automatically be enabled on all environments.

id.description: The unique ID for this family as generated by Fugue.

rule_ids.description: The rule IDs which belong to this family.

block.description: `fugue_family` manages a custom compliance family in Fugue.

compliance_families.description: The set of compliance families to enable in this environment, e.g. ["CIS-Google_v1.1.0"].

id.description: The unique ID for this environment as generated by Fugue.

project_id.description: The Google project ID. If not specified, it defaults to the project containing the provided service account email.

scan_interval.description: Controls the time in seconds between scheduled scans of this environment.

scan_schedule_enabled.description: Controls whether this environment is scanned on a schedule.

scan_status.description: Indicates whether a scan on this environment is currently running.

service_account_email.description: The Google service account email used to provide Fugue secure access to the Google project.

block.description: `fugue_google_environment` manages an Environment in Fugue corresponding to one Google project.

emails.description: The email addresses to be notified.

id.description: The ID for this notification as generated by Fugue.

name.description: The name of the notification. Must be unique.

topic_arn.description: SNS topic ARN to be notified.

block.description: `fugue_notification` manages a notification in Fugue.

cloud_provider.description: Indicates which environment type this rule is intended to be used with. One of: AWS, AWS_GOVCLOUD, AZURE, or GOOGLE.

id.description: The unique ID for this rule as generated by Fugue.

resource_type.description: The resource type evaluated by this rule. This may be a string like `AWS.S3.Bucket` or `MULTIPLE` to indicate that multiple types are evaluated.

rule_text.description: The Rego code for the rule, as a string.

severity.description: Severity of this rule: Informational, Low, Medium, High, or Critical.

source.description: The source of this rule: FUGUE or CUSTOM.

block.description: `fugue_rule` manages the code and configuration for a rule in Fugue.

comment.description: A comment describing the purpose of the waiver.

environment_id.description: The environment containing the resource to be waived.

id.description: The unique ID for this waiver as generated by Fugue.

resource_id.description: The ID string of the resource, such as `my-s3-bucket`.

resource_provider.description: A provider string like `aws.us-east-2` or `azure` describing the location of the resource.

resource_tag.description: A resource tag to match on, such as `Team:Engineering`.

resource_type.description: The type string of the resource, such as `AWS.S3.Bucket`.

rule_id.description: The ID of the rule to be waived, such as `FG_R00229`.

block.description: `fugue_rule_waiver` manages a rule waiver in Fugue for a given rule ID and resource.
`fugue_aws_environment` data source can be used to retrieve information about a Fugue AWS environment.

id.description: The unique ID for this environment.

name.description: Name of the field you want to apply this filter to.

block.description: Filters. The result is restricted to the intersection of the result of all filters.
`fugue_environment` data source can be used to retrieve information about a Fugue environment.

ids.description: List of the ID of each result.

name.description: Name of the field you want to apply this filter to.

block.description: Filters. The result is restricted to the intersection of the result of all filters.
Multi-result version of `fugue_environment` where the results are placed in the `ids` element.

id.description: The unique ID for this rule.

resource_type.description: The resource type of this rule.

name.description: Name of the field you want to apply this filter to.

block.description: Filters. The result is restricted to the intersection of the result of all filters.
`fugue_rule` data source can be used to retrieve information about a Fugue rule.

comment.description: The comment associated with this waiver.

environment_id.description: The ID of the environment this waiver is applied to.

id.description: The unique ID for this waiver.

resource_id.description: The ID of the resource the rule is being waived for.

resource_provider.description: The provider of the resource the rule is being waived for.

resource_tag.description: The type of the resource the rule is being waived for.

resource_type.description: The type of the resource the rule is being waived for.

rule_id.description: The ID of the rule being waived.

name.description: Name of the field you want to apply this filter to.

block.description: Filters. The result is restricted to the intersection of the result of all filters.
`fugue_rule_waiver` data source can be used to retrieve information about a Fugue rule waiver.

ids.description: List of the ID of each result.

name.description: Name of the field you want to apply this filter to.

block.description: Filters. The result is restricted to the intersection of the result of all filters.
Multi-result version of `fugue_rule_waiver` where the results are placed in the `ids` element.

ids.description: List of the ID of each result.

name.description: Name of the field you want to apply this filter to.

block.description: Filters. The result is restricted to the intersection of the result of all filters.
Multi-result version of `fugue_rule` where the results are placed in the `ids` element.
